intro: Utricularia tenuis var. poeppigii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat and the presence of bladder-like structures used to trap prey. The plant typically has slender stems and narrow leaves, which help reduce water loss in its often wet environment. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia and parts of Africa. Utricularia tenuis var. poeppigii is a popular species among carnivorous plant enthusiasts due to its unique morphology and ease of cultivation.
